intro: Schoberia linifolia, commonly known as the slenderleaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in open habitats such as plains, slopes, and along roadsides. Schoberia linifolia is drought-tolerant and has a deep root system that helps it survive in harsh, dry conditions.
